page.title: 06Forestry in Guiness:Felling
page.content: The trees are sold tarrited as standing.This means that every hundredth tree is felled and measured.These are then put on offer,measured,and the section of forest is set out to tender.The highest tender gets to buy the trees. They are then felled and hoisted on to the lorry.The trees are then taken to a sawmill,where they are made into fencing posts,strainers for fencing, fork lift pallets,and occasionally, garden furniture.The worst timber goes to make spandboard.Other types go to make housing rafters and fencing overlap. The forest is at present being harvested and replanted.It will de about fifty years before it can be harvested again.
